propertyGroup.name: Outlets
propertyGroup.documentation: Defines the locations to which output is generated.

property.name: configuration
property.documentation: The location to which Struts configuration files are generated. These are the files that typically appear in WEB-INF, such as validation-rules.xml and tiles-defs.xml.

property.name: controllers
property.documentation: The location to which any controllers are generated (this outlet contains classes which are fully generated and should not be touched).

property.name: controller-impls
property.documentation: The location to which controller implementations are generated (these are where your hooks go to your services).

property.name: managed-beans
property.documentation: The location to which any additional managed beans are generated (including layout options, etc).

property.name: messages
property.documentation: The location to which message resource bundles are generated.

property.name: jsps
property.documentation: Application JSPs: login pages, stylesheets, etc (basically anything in support of JSP view rendering).

property.name: forms
property.documentation: The forms to which input is stored are output here.

propertyGroup.name: Configuration
propertyGroup.documentation: The properties that provide configuration of the JSF configuration files.

property.name: facesConfig
property.documentation: The name of the JSF configuration file (this file stores the JSF managed bean form information and navigation rules).

property.name: formScope
property.documentation: The scope to given the forms. This value can be overriddem by a tagged value.

property.name: facesServletExtension
property.documentation: The extension used for the application's handling of JSF pages.

propertyGroup.name: UI Layout
propertyGroup.documentation: Properties related to the configuration of the user interface layout.

property.name: layoutOptionsName
property.documentation: Defines the name of the layout options class (which allows dynamic control of the UI's view layout).

property.name: layoutOptionsBeanName
property.documentation: Defines the bean name under which the layout options class will be stored.

property.name: sidebarLayout
property.documentation: The default layout to use for the navigation layout (this is only applicable when the menuLayout is side.

property.name: menuLayout
property.documentation:
The menu layout. Valid values are:
hbr
hur
hul
vbr
vur
vur

property.name: navigationTheme
property.documentation: The navigation theme to use (the possible choices are: ThemeOffice, ThemeMiniBlack, ThemeIE, ThemePanel).

propertyGroup.name: Messages and i18n
propertyGroup.documentation: Properties related to the configuration of messages and internationalization in general.

property.name: applicationName
property.documentation: The name of the application (this is used as the display name of the application).

property.name: normalizeMessages
property.documentation: Denotes the way application resource messages ought to be generated. When messages are normalized it means that elements with the same name will reuse the same label, even if they are located in entirely different use-cases or pages. This results in resource bundles that are not only smaller in size but also more straightforward to translate. The downside is that it will be less evident to customize labels for certain fields (which is rarely the case anyway). For backward compatibility reasons this flag is disabled by default.

property.name: welcomeFileName
property.documentation: The path of the JSP that is the welcome file.

property.name: managedBeansPackage
property.documentation: Defines the the package in which any extra managed-beans will be generated (such as the layout options class, etc).

property.name: xmlEncoding
property.documentation: Encoding for generated XML files.

property.name: formPattern
property.documentation: The pattern to use for constructing the form name, where {0} is the name of the controller operation capitalized.

property.name: formImplementationPattern
property.documentation: The pattern to use for constructing the form implementation name, where {0} is the name of the controller operation capitalized.

property.name: formBeanPattern
property.documentation: The pattern for constructing the name of the bean under which the form is stored, where {0} is the name of the controller operation.

property.name: controllerImplementationPattern
property.documentation: The pattern for constructing the name of the controller implementation class name (where {0} represents the modeled name of the controller).

property.name: messageResources
property.documentation: The path of the localized message resources (the .properties suffix is appended to this value when creating the actual file.).

property.name: jspIncludes
property.documentation: Defines the name of the default jsp includes file (this contains any message resources as well as tag libs.

property.name: servicePackageNamePattern
property.documentation: The name of the package in which to create the service files, {0} can be used to denote the package in which the service has been modeled.

property.name: serviceAccessorPattern
property.documentation:
The pattern to use when calling the backend code for <<Service>> lookups. For calling services you would use following patterns:
Spring: ${application.package}.ServiceLocator.instance().get{1}()
EJB: ${myPackage}.{1}Util.getHome().create()
